other_tests.findings: Growth of gram-positive bacilli in chains detected in all 4 blood culture bottles after 14 hours of incubation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Blood cultures obtained 3 hours following the initiation of antibiotic therapy were sterile.

other_tests.findings: Yielded 800 mL of serosanguinous fluid, with 4224 red blood cells, 1463 white blood cells.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Bacterial culture of the fluid did not grow; subsequent testing was positive for B anthracis-specific PCR.

other_tests.findings: Growth of B anthracis was detected only from the mediastinal lymph node; all other postmortem specimens were sterile.
All serum samples were nonreactive for IgG antibody to protective antigen component of anthrax toxins.
More than 1 L of serosanguinous fluid in the right pleural cavity; mediastinal lymph nodes were enlarged and hemorrhagic.
